content.description:
A short, but harder set of moves, with a dynamic finish.

 This climb is a sit start to a small left hand crimpy side pull that allows you to bump to the last two usable holds in the section. From there it's a dino to a good but sharp finishing hold up top.

 Traditionally this problem is done without using the Arete, as using it changes the climb dramatically.
content.location: The problem is a sit start in the middle of the blocky rock protrusion located on the left side of the small boulder wall. This area can be reached by walking to the left up the hill when you hit the large cliff face. The wall is easily identifiable compared to the steep dirt hillside it resides in.

content.description: The problem starts by moving low to the ground to the right from the large circular pocket, and starts moving upward once you hit the edge of the lower area where it turns into a small cave/overhang. Move up to the final holds with great feet but be warned the last two moves have sharp handholds.
content.location: The start is easy to find, use the pictures given for "kazoo" if you can't find the large pocket start. "Kazoo", "Traverse", and Mini Horn" all have the same start but each go in completely different directions.

content.description: A straight shot up the boulder from the large circular pocket. The top out is can be a little awkward.
content.location: Located on the large "Crown Jewel" boulder, somewhat in the center. The top out has a nice little tree next to it.

content.description: This problem starts at the lower left corner of the wall and works the arete all the way up to the corner. The top out can be a little tricky with the vegetation in the way.
The traverse along the Crown Jewel is simple and fun. Starting farther over on the right side is a nice was to make the problem longer but does not increase difficulty.
Sit start with your hands on the lip of the area the jets out from the left side. Bump your left hand up with a high right foot on the ledge. Compression hold into an easy finish and top out.
content.location: This rock face is overall easy to identify as it stand out from the rest of what you see while walking up the hill. If you start from the lower boulders at the base of the cliff this is a short and steep walk up to the left.

content.description: Nice spot at the top of the hill, a variety of easy to intermediate climbs all on the same boulder.
